newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Venezuela's Viasa faces drastic restructuring.
newsitem.headline: Venezuela's Viasa faces drastic restructuring.

text.p: Stockholders of Venezuelan airline Viasa will seek a radical restructuring of the near-bankrupt carrier early next year, the company said Wednesday.
Faced with losses of 20 billion bolivars ($42 million) in 1995, Viasa stockholders will propose shedding routes, reducing costs and cutting jobs at a meeting scheduled for Jan. 15, the company said.
The plan also envisions "a profound change in current collective labour contracts," it said.
A proposal by Viasa employees to seek new investors will be kept on hold until the restructuring plan is approved, it said.
Spanish airline Iberia owns 40 percent of the airline, and the Venezuelan bank Banco Provincial has a 15 percent stake and the Venezuelan government holds the balance.
